accessibility.text: When we calculate GDP, we want to know the amount (quantity) of goods and services produced. But in measuring quantity we ran into two problems:
When we calculate GDP, we want to know the amount (quantity) of goods and services produced. But in measuring quantity we ran into two problems:
We can not add apples and oranges and web pages and computers and hair cuts: we can not add quantities produced
When we calculate GDP, we want to know the amount (quantity) of goods and services produced. But in measuring quantity we ran into two problems:
We can not add apples and oranges and web pages and computers and hair cuts: we can not add quantities produced
Goods have different intrinsic values: More value is added to the raw materials to produce a computer than the value added to produce a pencil.
A country that produces 10,000 computers produces more value than a country that produces 10,000 pencils
GDP calculation must reflect these differences in value
